notes.text: This CSAF advisory was extracted from unstructured data and may contain inaccuracies. If you notice any errors, please reach out to the designated contact at CISA CSAF: central@cisa.dhs.gov

notes.text: Successful exploitation may allow an attacker to read/write memory, and/or induce a denial of service through a system restart, thus potentially leading to a delay in diagnosis and treatment of patients.
notes.title: Risk evaluation

notes.text: NCCIC recommends that users take defensive measures to minimize the risk of exploitation of these vulnerabilities. Specifically, users should:
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: NCCIC reminds organizations to perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to deploying defensive measures.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: NCCIC also provides a section for control systems security recommended practices on the ICS-CERT web page. NCCIC reminds organizations to perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to deploying defensive measures.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Organizations observing any suspected malicious activity should follow their established internal procedures and report their findings to NCCIC for tracking and correlation against other incidents.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available on the ICS-CERT website in the Technical Information Paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: No known public exploits specifically target these vulnerabilities. These vulnerabilities are exploitable from within the same local device subnet. High skill level is needed to exploit.
notes.title: Exploitability

document.title: Philips' IntelliVue Patient and Avalon Fetal Monitors

revision_history.summary: ICSMA-18-156-01 Philips' IntelliVue Patient and Avalon Fetal Monitors
ICSMA-18-156-01 Philips' IntelliVue Patient and Avalon Fetal Monitors (Update A)

product.name: Avalon Fetal/Maternal Monitors FM20/FM30/FM40/FM50: with software Revisions F.0 G.0 and J.3

branches.name: Rev J-M | (X3/MX100 for Rev M only)

product.name: IntelliVue Patient Monitors MX (MX400-550): Rev J-M and (X3/MX100 for Rev M only)
IntelliVue Patient Monitors MP Series (includingMP2/X2/MP30/MP50/MP70/NP90/MX700/800): Rev B-M

notes.text: The vulnerability allows an unauthenticated attacker to access memory (write-what-where) from an attacker-chosen device address within the same subnet.CVE-2018-10597 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 8.3 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:A/AC:H/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:H/I:H/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Philips will provide a remediation patch for specific supported versions, as well as an upgrade path for all versions. Philips will communicate service options to all affected install-base users.Philips recommends users obtain associated field change and service bulletin information from Philips by accessing their InCenter account at this location:
Please see the Philips product security website for the latest public security information on this matter and for other Philips products:
Philips provides the following mitigations for these vulnerabilities:

cwe.name: Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor

notes.text: The vulnerability allows an unauthenticated attacker to read memory from an attacker-chosen device address within the same subnet.CVE-2018-10599 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 6.4 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:A/AC:H/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:L/A:L).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Philips will provide a remediation patch for specific supported versions, as well as an upgrade path for all versions. Philips will communicate service options to all affected install-base users.Philips recommends users obtain associated field change and service bulletin information from Philips by accessing their InCenter account at this location:
Please see the Philips product security website for the latest public security information on this matter and for other Philips products:
Philips provides the following mitigations for these vulnerabilities:

notes.text: The vulnerability exposes an echo service, in which an attacker-sent buffer to an attacker-chosen device address within the same subnet is copied to the stack with no boundary checks, hence resulting in stack overflow.CVE-2018-10601 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 8.2 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:A/AC:H/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:H/I:L/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Philips will provide a remediation patch for specific supported versions, as well as an upgrade path for all versions. Philips will communicate service options to all affected install-base users.Philips recommends users obtain associated field change and service bulletin information from Philips by accessing their InCenter account at this location:
